rdf:RDF:
Policy Resource
A collection of, or a single Policy Reference
<-- You should mention here, which element you're replacing or renaming. AFAIK, this is the -Element here -->
policy references
A collection of Policy References
expiry
States how long the policy reference file (or policy) remains valid.
expiry
States how long the policy reference file (or policies) remains valid.
absolute date
An absolute date in http format.
maximum age
The maximum time before expiry.
start time
The time in http date format that the policy was validated.
policy reference A Policy Reference
about
The policy being referenced.
base
The policy base URI for includes and excludes.
include
Defines areas of the site to be covered by this policy.
exclude
Defines areas of the site not covered by this policy.
hint
A hint where other relevant policy references can be found.
hint
A hint where other relevant policy references can be found.
domain
The domain names to which the hint applies.
path
The location of the hinted policy reference files relative to the applicable host.
include
Cookies covered by the policy.
exclude
Cookies not covered by the policy
cookie description
A description of a set of cookies
domain
Matches the domain name part of the cookie.
path
Matches the path part of the cookie.
value
Matches the value part of the cookie.
name
Matches the name part of the cookie.
method
The name of a method to which the policy applies
policy A P3P Policy
disclosure
A natural language privacy statement
privacy statement
A natural language privacy statement
opt instructions
A link to instructions that users can follow to request or decline to have their data used for a particular purpose.
opt instructions
Instructions that users can follow to request or decline to have their data used for a particular purpose.
test
Used for testing purposes. If a policy is of type p3p:Test then the policy is just an example and as such it MUST be ignored.
entity
Identifies the legal entity making the representation of the privacy practices contained in the policy.
access
Indicates whether the site provides access to various kinds of information.
info class
A class of information types defined by P3P.
info
The superclass of all classes of information defined by p3p.
nonident
Identifiable data is not collected.
all
Access is given to all identifiable information.
contact and other
Access is given to identified online and physical contact information as well as to certain other identified data.
ident contact
Access is given to identified online and physical contact information.
otherident
Access is given to certain other identified data.
none
No access to identified data is given.
resolutionProcedures
A collection of dispute resolution procedures that may be followed for disputes about a service's privacy practices.
resolution procedure
A dispute resolution procedure.
customer service
Individual may complain to the Web site's customer service respresentative for resolution of disputes regarding the use of collected data.
independent organization
Individual may complain to an independent organization for resolution of disputes regarding the use of collected data.
court
Individual may file a legal complaint against the web site.
applicable law
Disputes arising in connection with the privacy statement will be resolved in accordance with the referenced law.
service The resolution services
verification
A resource which can be used for verification purposes.
remedy
The possible remedies in case a policy breach occurs.
remedy
A remedy in case a policy breach occurs.
remedy class A class of remedies.
correct
Errors or wrongful actions arising in connection with the privacy policy will be remedied by the service.
money
If the service provider violates its privacy policy it wil pay the individual an amount specified in the human readable privacy policy or the amount of damages.
law
Remedies for breaches of the policy statement will be determined based on the law referenced in the human readable description.
statement
Data practices that are applied to particular types of data
statement
A data practice applied to particular types of data
non identifiable
There is no data or no identifiable data collected.
consequence
Consequences that can be shown to a human user to explain why the suggested practice may be valuable in a particular instance even if the user would not normally allow the practice.
purpose
Defines the purpose for which the data practise is employed
purpose(always)
The purpose is always required; users cannot opt-in or opt-out of this use of their data.
purpose(opt in)
Data may be used for this purpose only when the user affirmatively requests this use.
purpose(opt out)
Data may be used for this purpose unless the user requests that it not be used in this way.
purpose
The purpose for which the data practise is employed
purpose class
The class of purpose classes
current activity
Information may be used by the service provider to complete the activity for which it was provided, whether a one-time activity such as returning the results from a Web search, forwarding an email message, or placing an order; or a recurring activity such as providing a subscription service, or allowing access to an online address book or electronic wallet.
administration
Information may be used for the technical support of the Web site and its computer system. This would include processing computer account information, information used in the course of securing and maintaining the site, and verification of Web site activity by the site or its agents.
research and development Information may be used to enhance, evaluate, or otherwise review the site, service, product, or market. This does not include personal information used to tailor or modify the content to the specific individual nor information used to evaluate, target, profile or contact the individual.
tailoring
Information may be used to tailor or modify content or design of the site where the information is used only for a single visit to the site and not used for any kind of future customization.
individual
Information may be used to create or build a record of an identified particular individual or computer.
psuedo
Information may be used to create or build a record of a particular individual or computer that is tied to a pseudonymous identifier, without tying identified data (such as name, address, phone number, or email address) to the record.
psuedo analysis
Information may be used to create or build a record of a particular individual or computer that is tied to a pseudonymous identifier, without tying identified data (such as name, address, phone number, or email address) to the record. This profile will be used to determine the habits, interests, or other characteristics of individuals for purpose of research, analysis and reporting, but it will not be used to attempt to identify specific individuals.
psuedo decision
Information may be used to create or build a record of a particular individual or computer that is tied to a pseudonymous identifier, without tying identified data (such as name, address, phone number, or email address) to the record. This profile will be used to determine the habits, interests, or other characteristics of individuals to make a decision that directly affects that individual, but it will not be used to attempt to identify specific individuals.
individual analysis
Information may be used to determine the habits, interests, or other characteristics of individuals and combine it with identified data for the purpose of research, analysis and reporting.
individual decision
Information may be used to determine the habits, interests, or other characteristics of individuals and combine it with identified data to make a decision that directly affects that individual
contact somehow
Information may be used to contact the individual
contact
Information may be used to contact the individual, through a communications channel other than voice telephone, for the promotion of a product or service. This includes notifying visitors about updates to the Web site.
historical preservation
Information may be archived or stored for the purpose of preserving social history as governed by an existing law or policy.
telemarketing
Information may be used to contact the individual via a voice telephone call for promotion of a product or service.
other
Information may be used in other ways.
recipient
A legal entity, or domain, beyond the service provider and its agents where data may be distributed
recipient always
The recipient always receives this data
recipient(opt in)
The recipient may receive this data only when the user affirmatively requests it
recipient(opt out)
The recipient will receive data unless the user requests that it not be used in this way
recipient
A legal entity, or domain, beyond the service provider and its agents where data may be distributed
recipient class
A class of legal entities, or domains, beyond the service provider and its agents where data may be distributed
ours
Ourselves and/or our entities acting as our agents or entities for whom we are acting as an agent
delivery
Delivery services possibly following different practices
same
Legal entities following our practices
other recipient
Legal entities following different practices
unrelated
Legal entities whose data usage practices are not known by the original service provider
public
Public fora such as bulletin boards, public directories, or commercial CD-ROM directories
recipient description a description of the recipient
retention policy
The kind of retention policy that applies to the data referenced by the subject
retention policy A retention policy
retention policy class
A Class of retention policies
no retention
Information is not retained for more than a brief period of time necessary to make use of it during the course of a single online interaction
stated purpose
Information is retained to meet the stated purpose
legal requirement
As required by law or liability under applicable law: Information is retained to meet a stated purpose, but the retention period is longer because of a legal requirement or liability
business practices
Information is retained under a service provider's stated business practices
indefinitely
Information is retained for an indeterminate period of time
data the data to be transferred or inferred
optional
whether or not the site requires visitors to submit this data element
category
hints to users and user agents as to the intended uses of the data
category category
category class
A classification of data, a subclass of Category.
physical
Information that allows an individual to be contacted or located in the physical world - such as telephone number or address.
online
Information that allows an individual to be contacted or located on the Internet - such as email
unique id
Non-financial identifiers, excluding government-issued identifiers, issued for purposes of consistently identifying or recognizing the individual
purchase
Information actively generated by the purchase of a product or service, including information about the method of payment
financial
Information about an individual's finances including account status and activity information such as account balance, payment or overdraft history, and information about an individual's purchase or use of financial instruments including credit or debit card information
computer
Information about the computer system that the individual is using to access the network - such as the IP number, domain name, browser type or operating system.
navigation
Data passively generated by browsing the Web site - such as which pages are visited, and how long users stay on each page
interactive
Data actively generated from or reflecting explicit interactions with a service provider through its site - such as queries to a search engine, or logs of account activity
demographic
Data about an individual's characteristics - such as gender, age, and income
content
The words and expressions contained in the body of a communication - such as the text of email, bulletin board postings, or chat room communications
state
Mechanisms for maintaining a stateful session with a user or automatically recognizing users who have visited a particular site or accessed particular content previously - such as HTTP cookies
political
Membership in or affiliation with groups such as religious organizations, trade unions, professional associations, political parties, etc
health
information about an individual's physical or mental health, sexual orientation, use or inquiry into health care services or products, and purchase of health care services or products
preference
Data about an individual's likes and dislikes - such as favorite color or musical tastes
location
Information that can be used to identify an individual's current physical location and track them as their location changes - such as GPS position data
government
Identifiers issued by a government for purposes of consistently identifying the individual
other
Other types of data not captured by the above definitions
optional
A P3P processor is not required to understand the value of the rdf:valueof property of resources of this type.
mandatory
A P3P processor is required to understand the value of the rdf:valueof property of resources of this type.
optional
A p3p processor is not required to understand the value of the only property of the value of this property.
mandatory
A p3p processor is required to understand the value of the only property of the value of this property.
Relative To
Defines what context the class is relative to
Relative Class
A Class whose extension is context dependent
data schema or structure
The union of Data Elements and Data Structures
data element
A specific item of data a service might collect
data structure
a named, abstract definition of a group of data elements
unstructured data element
A data element with no component parts
structured data element A data element with component parts
variable category
A data schema component with no fixed categories.
component A part of a data structure
date Specifies a date
ymd
ymd
year Year
year
month Month
month
day Day
day
hms
hms
hour Hour
hour
minute Minute
minute
second Second
second
fraction of second
fraction of second
time zone
time zone
login
Specify information (IDs and passwords) for computer systems and Web sites which require authentication
login id
login id
login password
login password
person name
Information about the naming of a person
prefix
prefix
given name (First Name)
given name (First Name)
family name (Last Name)
family name (Last Name)
middle name
middle name
name suffix
name suffix
nickname
nickname
certificate
identity certificates (like, for example, X.509)
certificate key
certificate key
certificate format
certificate format
telephone number Telephone number
international telephone Code
international telephone Code
local telephone Area Code
local telephone Area Code
telephone number
telephone number
telephone extension
telephone extension
telephone optional Comments
telephone optional Comments
contact Contact information.
postal address Information
postal contact information
telecommunications information
telecommunications contact information
online address information
online contact information
postal
A postal mailing address
name
name
street address
street address
city
city
state or province
state or province
postal code
postal code
country name
country name
organization name
organization name
telecom
telecommunication information about a person.
telephone number
telephone number
fax number
fax number
mobile telephone Number
mobile telephone Number
pager number
pager number
online
Specifies online information about a person
email address
email address
home page address
home page address
uri
Uniform Resource Identifier
uri authority
uri authority
uri stem
uri stem
query portion of uri
query portion of uri
ip address
the hostname and IP address of a system
complete host and domain name
complete host and domain name
partial host name
partial host name
full ip address
full ip address
partial ip address
partial ip address
web server log information
information typically stored in Web-server access logs
uri of requested resources
uri of requested resources
request timestamp
request timestamp
clients ip address or hostname
clients ip address or hostname
other
other
http request method
http request method
data bytes in response
rata bytes in response
response status code
response status code
http info
information carried by the HTTP protocol which is not covered by the loginfo structure
last uri requested by the user
last uri requested by the user
user agent information
user agent information
user data info
general information about the user
users name
users name
users birth date
users birth date
users login information
users login information
users identity certificate
users identify certificate
users gender (Male or Female)
users gender (Male or Female)
users employer
users employer
department
Department or Division of Organization where User is Employed
department
users job title
users job title
users home contact information
users home contact information
users business contact information
users business contact information
Third Party Data Info
general information about the third Party
name
name
birth date
birth date
login information
login information
identity certificate
identify certificate
gender (Male or Female)
gender (Male or Female)
employer
employer
department
Department or Division of Organization where Third Party is Employed
department
job title
job title
home contact information
home contact information
business contact information
business contact information
business information
a subset of user data relevant for organizations
organization name
organization name
department or division
department or division
identity certificate
identity certificate
contact information
contact information
legal entity
A legal entity such as a business
dynamic information
Data elements that do not have fixed value
click-stream
click-stream
http protocol information
http protocol information
users interaction with resources
users interaction with resources
use of http cookies
use of http cookies
miscellaneous
miscellaneous
search terms
search terms
transaction history
transaction history
image An image or logo
width
Width in pixels of the image
height
Height in pixels of the image
alternative text
A very short text alternative to the image
short description
A short human readable description of the subject
long description
A human readable description of the subject
image
An image or logo associated with the subject

p3p:DataElementComponent.rdfs:label: referrer
p3p:DataElementComponent.rdfs:comment: last uri requested by the user

p3p:StructuredDataElementClass.rdfs:label: referrer
p3p:StructuredDataElementClass.rdfs:comment: last uri requested by the user
